page.title: 14ENERGY IN NENTHEAD
page.content: Almost all households in our block receive electricity from Norweb.There is no mains gas in Nenthead,but some houses use bottled gas.Few houses use oil for central heating_the school is one place which does.Pry House<G.R. 779447> has its own electric generator fuelled by diesel. The majority of houses around Nenthead use coal for their main source of heat.A lot of houses are fitted with rayburns or similar solid fuel cooker stoves which burn anthracite <burns much hotter than ordinary coal>.Coalmen can get their supplies of anthracite locally from the Alston pits_Clarghyll,Flow Edge and Ayle.A <1cwt> bag of anthracite costs Â£5.20. Two houses tried wind powered gener- ators recently,but could not produce enough electric for self-sufficiency.
